message:
Anyone here using cloud storage for personal, off-site backup purposes? Basically I need 1-2TB of storge space with the most important factor having an FTP or FTP-like access to upload and download (Web based upload sucks, and I don't want to auto sync files because this defeats the whole point of backup).

All for something like $10/month... I have been searching for a day and none of the mainstream solutions (GDrive, OneDrive, etc.) fits, neither I found a low-end VPS with such disk space... maybe you can enlighten me with your experience?

Thanks for your help!

data.message: Try Amazon S3, it doesn't support FTP (as I recall), but it has a comprehensive command line client that you can use as you want.
So do you use any form of encryption for your files once they're on the server?
https://www.backblaze.com is your friend with unlimited *encrypted* storage at 5$/month only, I'm using it personally and highly recommend it.
S3 seems a fit for your needs, you might encrypt it at rest with kms, use a lambda function for uploads and downloads.
why you didn't think of creating your own server?
This seems good with many positive reviews and fits the bill nicely https://www.crashplan.com/en-us/ Anyone using it?
AWS S3: https://aws.amazon.com/s3/. Doesn't support FTP but has command line tools to copy or sync files in addition to GUI tools. Also supports file versioning and access control.
Thanks everyone for teh eye-opening discusion, I went ahead with CrashPlan and currently doing a 1.2TB backup, lets see how it goes, next up if I dont like it is Backblaze!
S3 for rapid access/Glacier for backups
